tourBios.exmtStatus: Exempt - Next 25 Money Winners from 2014 Web.com Tour Finals
tourBios.curYearHigh: Thanks to opening rounds of 4-under 68 and 5-under 67 at the Silverado Resort and Spa, claimed a T10 with six others at 11-under 277 in the season's first event, the Frys.com Open...Playing on the Japan Golf Tour in November 2015, opened with a 1-over 72 at the Dunlop Phoenix then rattled off three rounds in the 60s (68-68-66) to finish T7 with Thanyakon Khrongpha, four shots behind winner Yusaku Miyazato...Overcame a second-round 2-over 73 in his first start at the Waste Management Phoenix Open with weekend rounds of 69-65 to finish T6 at TPC Scottsdale. The final-round 65 was the day's low round. His top-10 finish came on the heels of two missed cuts and at a time when he told media early in the week that he felt "dialed in again and ready for a strong finish."
tourBios.carHigh:
2014: Made 10 cuts in 16 PGA TOUR starts, highlighted by a pair of top-10 finishes. Finished 142nd in the FedExCup standings. Attempted to regain exempt status for the 2014-15 PGA TOUR Season via the Web.com Tour Finals...In his only Web.com Tour Regular Season start, finished T20 at the Panama Claro Championship...Thanks to a third-round, 6-under 64, entered the final round of the Sony Open in Hawaii trailing Chris Kirk by just one stroke before a final-round, 1-over 71 led to a T8 finish. His first made cut in three career starts on the PGA TOUR led to a spot in the Farmers Insurance Open two weeks later, based on finishing in the top-10 (missed the cut)...Finished T4 at The Greenbrier Classic and posted four rounds in the 60s for the first time in his career. Performed the feat again two starts later, with four rounds in the 60s leading to a T25 finish at the RBC Canadian Open...Made a promising start in the Web.com Tour Finals, finishing T19 at the Hotel Fitness Championship and T12 at the Chiquita Classic, but his run ended with missed cuts in the last two Finals' events.

2013: Finished the year with a win, a T3, eight top-25s and $248,372 in earnings, making 15 cuts in 17 starts. Was 1st in Total Driving, 2nd in All-Around Ranking and Birdie Average (4.46) and 5th in Scoring Average (69.27)...Collected his first career win with an impressive performance at the South Georgia Classic in Valdosta. Staked himself to a seven-stroke lead after 54 holes when he fired a course-record, 9-under 63 in the third round at Kinderlou Forest GC. His record-setting day included a bogey at the final hole, and his score was five shots better than anyone else Saturday. Needed only a 1-over 73 in the last round to secure a four-stroke victory and the first-place check for $117,000, which moved him from No. 55 to No. 3 on the money list. Had a couple of stumbles on the last day but recovered each time and never let anyone get closer than the four-shot final margin. His week also included a pair of hole-out eagles on par-4s during both the third and final rounds...Was T9 at the United Leasing Championship in late June...Two weeks later, became the fourth player in Web.com Tour history to shoot a 59 (12-under) when he recorded the magic number in his final round. Had 10 birdies and one eagle. Made a 6-foot birdie putt on No. 18. Finished T3 in the event, getting to 21-under, a stroke out of the Steven Alker-Ashley Hall playoff...Two weeks later, added a T6 at the Albertsons Boise Open, which was highlighted by an ace in Saturday's third round. Finished 20-under par and three shots out of a playoff...Finished T16 in the Cox Classic to end the Regular Season seventh in earnings and secure his 2013-14 PGA TOUR card.

2012: Earned just two top-10 finishes in 23 Web.com Tour starts....Best finished came in June when he was T6 at The Rex Hospital Open...Four months later added a second when he was T10 at the Neediest Kids Championship...Posted his low career round on the Web.com Tour when he shot a second-round 7-under-par 64 at the Pacific Rubiales Colombia in his first start of the campaign. 2011: Began the season with no status on Tour...Earned his first career top-10 with a T3 at the Stadion Classic at UGA where he was a Monday qualifier. Collected enough money with his finish to earn Special Temporary Membership for the 2011 season...Followed that with a T25 in his next start at the BMW Charity Pro-Am...Qualified for the U.S. Open but missed the cut at Congressional CC, shooting rounds of 79-76...The following week, at the Mexico Open, he finished solo third after leading the field in birdies, with 25...Ended the year No. 7 in Final-Round Scoring Average. 2010: Missed the cut in his first two Web.com Tour starts, at the Fort Smith Classic and the Chattanooga Classic...Was a two-time Hooters Tour winner and was named Rookie of the Year. Also played the Canadian Tour and won the Dakota Dunes Casino Open after gaining entry into the event on a sponsor exemption. 2009: Played primarily on the Hooters Tour.
tourBios.otherCarHigh: Started his college career at the University of Alabama-Birmingham and then transferred to Clayton State in Morrow, Ga., near Atlanta. Three-time All-America. Winner of the Peach Belt Conference Championship and seven other college events. Winner of the 2008 Alabama Amateur.
tourBios.personal: List his mom, Kim Wilcox, and Rich Smith as instructors...Mom, Kim, coaches the University of Alabama-Birmingham women's golf team...Says playing in the 2011 U.S. Open is his biggest thrill in golf, and finishing college is his biggest thrill outside of the game...Lists Cascata GC in Las Vegas and Carambola G&CC in St. Croix as his favorite courses to play and would like to play Augusta National...Uses only quarters to mark his golf ball..Never travels without his iPod...Favorite teams include the Auburn Tigers and Atlanta Falcons...Favorite TV shows are "Seinfeld" and "South Park," and "Pulp Fiction" is his favorite movie...Favorite entertainers are Sublime and Marshall Tucker...Spaghetti is his favorite food...Tiger Woods is favorite athlete to watch...Los Angeles and Calgary are favorite cities to visit, and St. Croix is favorite vacaction spot...Website is willwilcoxgolf.com...Favorite apps are Navigon and Rainstick...Carries Chex Mix and bananas in his golf bag for snacks...Would include Jack Nicklaus, Woods and Boo Weekley in his dream foursome...Says nobody knows he's allergic to everything on a golf course...Bucket list includes playing on the PGA TOUR...Favorite quote is 'Dig deep, believe in yourself."...Is involved in the junior golf program in Alabama.

tourBios.curYrHigh: Thanks to opening rounds of 4-under 68 and 5-under 67 at the Silverado Resort and Spa, claimed a T10 with six others at 11-under 277 in the season's first event, the Frys.com Open...Playing on the Japan Golf Tour in November 2015, opened with a 1-over 72 at the Dunlop Phoenix then rattled off three rounds in the 60s (68-68-66) to finish T7 with Thanyakon Khrongpha, four shots behind winner Yusaku Miyazato...Overcame a second-round 2-over 73 in his first start at the Waste Management Phoenix Open with weekend rounds of 69-65 to finish T6 at TPC Scottsdale. The final-round 65 was the day's low round. His top-10 finish came on the heels of two missed cuts and at a time when he told media early in the week that he felt "dialed in again and ready for a strong finish."

His top-10 finish came on the heels of two missed cuts and at a time when he told media early in the week that he felt "dialed in again and ready for a strong finish."
tourBios.carHigh:
2014-15: Collected four top-10 finishes in 17 starts, highlighted by a runner-up finish in his home state of Alabama. In his first start in the FedExCup Playoffs, missed the cut at The Barclays. Was forced to withdraw before the start of the following week's Deutsche Bank Championship due to a knee injury. Finished the season ranked 97th in the FedExCup standings...Fired a final-round 67 with seven birdies and two bogeys on the card to jump 28 spots for a T6 finish at the Puerto Rico Open...Started John Deere Classic's final round by holing out for eagle from 113 yards on the 400-yard par-4 No. 1 hole at TPC Deere Run. Finished T8 with three other players...The Birmingham native dropped a 60-foot bomb for birdie on his 72nd hole to claim solo-second at 16-under at the Barbasol Championship in Auburn/Opelika, Ala. He also birdied No. 17 en route to his final-round, 4-under 67. The runner-up finish betters his previous career-best of T4 from the 2014 Greenbrier Classic. Because of travel delays, was only able to practice on the front nine Tuesday. Because of inclement weather Wednesday, he only got through the front nine again for the pro-am. Thursday's first round was the first time he had seen Grand National's back nine, though it certainly proved no detriment. He played the back nine in 10-under as opposed to 6-under on the front...At the Barracuda Championship that used the Modified Stableford Format, collected his third top-10 finish in four starts, a T10.

2013-14: Made 10 cuts in 16 PGA TOUR starts, highlighted by a pair of top-10 finishes. Finished 142nd in the FedExCup standings. Attempted to regain exempt status for the 2014-15 PGA TOUR Season via the Web.com Tour Finals...In his only Web.com Tour start, finished T20 at the Panama Claro Championship...Thanks to a third-round, 6-under 64, entered the final round of the Sony Open in Hawaii trailing Chris Kirk by just one stroke before a final-round, 1-over 71 led to a T8 finish. His first made cut in three career starts on the PGA TOUR led to a spot in the Farmers Insurance Open two weeks later, based on finishing in the top-10 (missed the cut)...Finished T4 at The Greenbrier Classic and posted four rounds in the 60s for the first time in his career. Performed the feat again two starts later, with four rounds in the 60s leading to a T25 finish at the RBC Canadian Open...Made a promising start in the Web.com Tour Finals, finishing T19 at the Hotel Fitness Championship and T12 at the Chiquita Classic, but his run ended with missed cuts in the last two Finals' events.

 2012: Earned just two top-10 finishes in 23 Web.com Tour starts....Best finished came in June when he was T6 at The Rex Hospital Open...Four months later added a second when he was T10 at the Neediest Kids Championship...Posted his low career round on the Web.com Tour when he shot a second-round 7-under-par 64 at the Pacific Rubiales Colombia in his first start of the campaign. 

2011: Began the season with no status on Tour...Earned his first career top-10 with a T3 at the Stadion Classic at UGA where he was a Monday qualifier. Collected enough money with his finish to earn Special Temporary Membership for the 2011 season...Followed that with a T25 in his next start at the BMW Charity Pro-Am...Qualified for the U.S. Open but missed the cut at Congressional CC, shooting rounds of 79-76...The following week, at the Mexico Open, he finished solo third after leading the field in birdies, with 25...Ended the year No. 7 in Final-Round Scoring Average. 

2010: Missed the cut in his first two Web.com Tour starts, at the Fort Smith Classic and the Chattanooga Classic...Was a two-time Hooters Tour winner and was named Rookie of the Year. Also played the Canadian Tour and won the Dakota Dunes Casino Open after gaining entry into the event on a sponsor exemption. 

Amateur: Started his college career at the University of Alabama-Birmingham and then transferred to Clayton State in Morrow, Ga., near Atlanta. Three-time All-America. Winner of the Peach Belt Conference Championship and seven other college events. Winner of the 2008 Alabama Amateur.
tourBios.personal: Says playing in the 2011 U.S. Open is his biggest thrill in golf, and finishing college is his biggest thrill outside the game…Lists Cascata GC in Las Vegas and Carambola G&CC in St. Croix as his favorite courses to play and would like to play Augusta National…Uses only quarters to mark his golf ball...Never travels without his iPod…Favorite teams include the Auburn Tigers and Atlanta Falcons…Favorite TV shows are "Seinfeld" and "South Park," and "Pulp Fiction" is his favorite movie…Favorite entertainers are Sublime and Marshall Tucker…Spaghetti is his favorite food…Tiger Woods is favorite athlete to watch…Los Angeles and Calgary are favorite cities to visit, and St. Croix is favorite vacation spot…Twitter account is @willwilcoxgolf…Favorite apps are Navigon and Rainstick…Carries Chex Mix and bananas in his golf bag for snacks…Would include Jack Nicklaus, Woods and Boo Weekley in his dream foursome…Says nobody knows he's allergic to everything on a golf course…Favorite quote is 'Dig deep, believe in yourself."…Is involved in the Alabama Junior Golf Association, which is run by his family...Got his start in golf by going to work with his mom, a golf pro, every day.

dyn.dynResults: His best finish on the PGA TOUR in 2016 is T6th at the Waste Management Phoenix Open.
dyn.dynStats: He ranks T98th in Scoring Average (Actual) on the PGA TOUR.
